channel.title: Libraria - New books
channel.description: New books are available every week

item.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
item.description: One Hundred Years of Solitudes a 1967 novel by Colombian author Gabriel García Márquez that tells the multi-generational story of the Buendia family, whose patriarch, Jose Arcadio Buendia, founded the (fictitious) town of Macondo. The novel is often cited as one of the supreme achievements in literature
